issue.title: rclone: ftp tls handshake fail - no shared cipher

repository.name: packages
repository.description: Community maintained packages for OpenWrt. Documentation for submitting pull requests is in CONTRIBUTING.md

issue.body:
### Package Name

rclone

### Maintainer

ï¼ˆ@Elon Huang)

### OpenWrt Version

24.10.2

### OpenWrt Target/Subtarget

mediatek / filogic 

### Steps to Reproduce

root@OpenWrt:~# rclone.1.70.2 --version
rclone v1.70.2
- os/version: openwrt 24.10.2 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 6.6.93 (aarch64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: arm64 (ARMv8 compatible)
- go/version: go1.23.10
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none

root@OpenWrt:~# rclone.1.70.2 -vv lsf starmoon: --config=/etc/rclone/rclone.
conf
2025/07/20 18:52:28 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.70.2" starting with parameters ["rclone.1.70.2" "-vv" "lsf" "starmoon:" "--config=/etc/rclone/rclone.conf"]
2025/07/20 18:52:28 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "starmoon:"
2025/07/20 18:52:28 DEBUG : Using config file from "/etc/rclone/rclone.conf"
2025/07/20 18:52:28 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: Connecting to FTP server
2025/07/20 18:52:28 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: dial("tcp","<starmoon_ftp>:21")
2025/07/20 18:52:28 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: > dial: conn=117.84.102.242:54996->121.235.237.101:21, err=<nil>
2025/07/20 18:52:28 CRITICAL: Failed to create file system for "starmoon:": NewFs: failed to make FTP connection to "starmoon.org.cn:21": remote error: tls: handshake failure

==> /var/log/proftpd/proftpd.log <==
Jul 21 02:16:17 linux.localdomain proftpd[9032] 192.168.18.1 (::ffff:117.84.102.242[::ffff:117.84.102.242]): FTP session closed.
Jul 21 02:16:29 linux.localdomain proftpd[9202] 192.168.18.1 (::ffff:117.84.102.242[::ffff:117.84.102.242]): FTP session opened.

==> /var/log/proftpd/tls.log <==
Jul 21 02:16:29 mod_tls/2.4.2[9202]: TLS/TLS-C requested, starting TLS handshake
Jul 21 02:16:29 mod_tls/2.4.2[9202]: unable to accept TLS connection: protocol error:
  (1) error:1408A0C1:SSL routines:SSL3_GET_CLIENT_HELLO:no shared cipher
Jul 21 02:16:29 mod_tls/2.4.2[9202]: TLS/TLS-C negotiation failed on control channel

==> /var/log/proftpd/proftpd.log <==
Jul 21 02:16:29 linux.localdomain proftpd[9202] 192.168.18.1 (::ffff:117.84.102.242[::ffff:117.84.102.242]): FTP session closed.

================================================
root@OpenWrt:~# rclone.1.69.1  --version
rclone v1.69.1
- os/version: openwrt 24.10.2 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 6.6.93 (aarch64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: arm64 (ARMv8 compatible)
- go/version: go1.21.13
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none
root@OpenWrt:~# rclone.1.69.1  -vv lsf starmoon: --config=/etc/rclone/rclone
.conf
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.69.1" starting with parameters ["rclone.1.69.1" "-vv" "lsf" "starmoon:" "--config=/etc/rclone/rclone.conf"]
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "starmoon:"
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : Using config file from "/etc/rclone/rclone.conf"
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: Connecting to FTP server
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: dial("tcp","<starmoon_ftp>:21")
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>n:21: > dial: conn=*fshttp.timeoutConn, err=<nil>
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: dial("tcp","121.235.237.101:60138")
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>n:21: > dial: conn=*tls.Conn, err=<nil>
movie/
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : 3 go routines active
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: closing 1 unused connections

==> /var/log/proftpd/proftpd.log <==
Jul 21 02:57:03 linux.localdomain proftpd[17167] 192.168.18.1 (::ffff:117.84.102.242[::ffff:117.84.102.242]): FTP session opened.

==> /var/log/proftpd/tls.log <==
Jul 21 02:57:03 mod_tls/2.4.2[17167]: TLS/TLS-C requested, starting TLS handshake
Jul 21 02:57:03 mod_tls/2.4.2[17167]: TLSv1/SSLv3 connection accepted, using cipher AES128-GCM-SHA256 (128 bits)

==> /var/log/proftpd/proftpd.log <==
Jul 20 18:57:03 linux.localdomain proftpd[17167] 192.168.18.1 (::ffff:117.84.102.242[::ffff:117.84.102.242]): Preparing to chroot to directory '/home/share'
Jul 20 18:57:03 linux.localdomain proftpd[17167] 192.168.18.1 (::ffff:117.84.102.242[::ffff:117.84.102.242]): USER movierc: Login successful.



### Actual Behaviour

It works fine with rclone 1.69.1 but failed when I upgraded to 1.70.2 with same configuration file(s). 

### Confirmation Checklist

- [x] The package is maintained in this repository.
- [x] I understand that issues related to [the base OpenWrt repository](https://github.com/openwrt/openwrt/issues) or [LuCI repository](https://github.com/openwrt/luci/issues) will be closed.
- [x] I am reporting an issue for OpenWrt, not an unsupported fork.

body:
Try this flag

      --ftp-disable-tls13        Disable TLS 1.3 (workaround for FTP servers with buggy TLS)

> Try this flag
> 
> ```
>   --ftp-disable-tls13        Disable TLS 1.3 (workaround for FTP servers with buggy TLS)
> ```

I tried but no difference.

Seems to be the same cause as https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/8565? The versions seem to match up and so do the ciphers.

> Jul 21 02:57:03 mod_tls/2.4.2[17167]: TLSv1/SSLv3 connection accepted, using cipher AES128-GCM-SHA256 (128 bits)

Can you try adding `GODEBUG=tlsrsakex=1` to the environment variables and see if that fixes the issue?

> Seems to be the same cause as [#8565](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/8565)? The versions seem to match up and so do the ciphers.
> 
> > Jul 21 02:57:03 mod_tls/2.4.2[17167]: TLSv1/SSLv3 connection accepted, using cipher AES128-GCM-SHA256 (128 bits)
> 
> Can you try adding `GODEBUG=tlsrsakex=1` to the environment variables and see if that fixes the issue?

It works with this environment variable set. 

It seems that it was changed with GO 1.22. Can we make it permenantly buy tricking the soure code?

> By default, cipher suites without ECDHE support are no longer offered by either clients or servers during pre-TLS 1.3 handshakes. This change can be reverted with the tlsrsakex=1 GODEBUG setting.

issue.title: ftp: allow insecure TLS ciphers - fixes #8701

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

Added config field to allow insecure TLS ciphers that were disabled in Go 1.22.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/8701

#### Checklist

- [X] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [X] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [X] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [X] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [X] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
Can you try your platform appropriate build from here and see if it fixes the issue (without needing the environment variable): https://beta.rclone.org/branch/8701/v1.71.0-beta.8959.53825c56a.8701/

You will need to specify `--ftp-allow-insecure-tls-ciphers` on the command line.

> Can you try your platform appropriate build from here and see if it fixes the issue (without needing the environment variable): https://beta.rclone.org/branch/8701/v1.71.0-beta.8959.53825c56a.8701/
> 
> You will need to specify `--ftp-allow-insecure-tls-ciphers` on the command line.

It works. thank you for your great effort.

PS: Maybe it's better to change this option to '--ftp-disable-insecure-tls-ciphers'  to make it compatiable with existence running configuration. (but this is not the way that GO 1.22 prefer.)

> PS: Maybe it's better to change this option to '--ftp-disable-insecure-tls-ciphers' to make it compatiable with existence running configuration. (but this is not the way that GO 1.22 prefer.)

I'd prefer to be secure by default. That is the preferred way for most security teams, then the user has to make a deliberate action to opt into insecure ciphers. There is a reason that those ciphers are marked insecure - they have some cryptographic flaw which makes them breakable.
